1.title: The Miseducation of Vincent Ranieri
1.plot: Vince, posing as Frank Briggs, meets with Ryan Hendrix, an alluring and mysterious new client. Vince is confronted by Darby Shaffer and Milo Gephardt about Frank's whereabouts.

2.title: Nothing was the Same
2.plot: Neil Lydecker was already have a bad day, it's about to get worse when the uncle of one of his clients makes his displeasure known.

3.title: All That Glitters
3.plot: When Darby's sexual misconduct article sparks controversy, she finds herself on opposing sides with Janice. Angered by the media exposure the story has given Darby, Val reveals why she really she came to town.

4.title: Dead Bird in a Hand
4.plot: Vince plots with Neil on how to handle Ramon. Milo's struggles with old demons in the aftermath of Dru's murder at the hands of Detectives Kinkaid and Knox.

5.title: On the Road to Damascus
5.plot: Janice confronts Vince about his recent actions and Vince discloses the truth about his relationship with Frank Briggs.

6.title: The Long Kiss Goodbye
6.plot: In the season finale, Janice, taken back by Darby's recent actions, meets with Zakiyah Burch to make her an interesting offer. A shocking secret about Vince's new client is revealed.

1.title: A Man Like You
1.plot: Skip tracer Frank Briggs meets a man looking to hide from his disreputable employers and becomes a skip maker to help the man disappear. However this comes with a caveat as Frank discovers some people should not be allowed to disappear.

2.title: You're the Guy
2.plot: When Frank aids the main witness of a violent crime, it draws the attention of journalist Darby Shaffer as well as amoral private investigator, Vincent Ranieri.

3.title: Apply Pressure and Squeeze
3.plot: While out on a stakeout with Milo, Frank gets an intriguing offer from Darby.

4.title: D Is for Darby
4.plot: Darby's loyalties are tested when she meets with her editor, Bruce Stallworth and receives some distressing news about her future at the newspaper.

5.title: Thieves in the Temple
5.plot: Milo's past comes back to haunt him as he is forced to chose between loyalty to a friend or his livelihood with the woman he loves.

6.title: Short Change Hero
6.plot: Lives are changed and secrets are revealed in the season finale. Frank, Darby and Milo finally unite to drive off a client's abusive ex-boyfriend. Frank and Darby gets unexpected news, as threats, old and new, rear their heads.

imdb.title: Herrings
plot: Frank Briggs is a skip maker. Acting as an one-man witness protection agency, he provides his clients peace of mind by disguising their internet identity; allowing to basically hide in plain sight. However, as Frank soon learns, there are some people who should not be allowed to disappear.
synopsis: Disappearing is living a virtual existence. Technology has given us the ability to not be physically connected to anything. You can bank online, you can pay online and order things online. You dont have to physically go anywhere. Technology has really made it so we can live virtual. However, this all comes with a caveat, once a persons information is online, its available for everyone to see and use for their own purposes. This is where Frank Briggs comes in, he takes that information and places it in a hall of mirrors.Once you enter his digital hall of mirrors, your every Web inquiry, online deposit, social media post and email to Mom will take crazy, cockeyed turns from self-expression into misdirection until poof! you emerge months later a virtual individual with all the freedom of a newborn. What you do then is entirely up to you; this magic man has no intention of breaking the law by helping you forge a new identity. When life becomes too much, Frank Briggs can help you disappear.Despite he predilection for working in the shadows, Frank suffers from the same malady plaguing so many today, the need for recognition. Aiding him in this is Darby Shaffer, a talented young journalist for Philadelphia This Week, an alt-newspaper. In Frank, she sees the story that will elevate her career in a declining industry, but she also has another reason for covering Frank, as she hopes to find a way to hide her the demons from her past.Also aiding Frank is his long-time friend Milo Gephardt, a jack of all trades, master of none but knows the streets inside and out, maybe too well. Milo is a man who never got a break so he makes his own, rarely with a positive outcome. Each episode, these three character try to aid someone trying to disappear for one reason or another. Whether it be a woman try to elude her violent ex-lover, a young man who just won the lottery or an eye-witness of a violent crime. Each case mirrors something occurring in the lives of our protagonists and as the series progresses, we discover each character has their own hall of mirrors they want to escape from.
